events.text:
As I walked back inside, I couldn't help but think I should just give myself up. This wasn't me.
I didn't always see eye to eye with the LBPD, with Olivia, with the Chief. I cut my share of corners. But I couldn't keep this up. I'd have to turn myself in, admit it. Tell Olivia, see the disappointment in her eyes. I'd stared down harder truths than that, hadn't I?
Aren't you forgetting something though, John? The wife. Little Billy. Leave them with a murderer for a husband and a father?
No. I couldn't do that. Steel your gut, stare down the barrel of your own poor decisions, and bite this goddamn bullet John Souls. You were never a perfect man. But at least you could be a free one.
For them.
Speaking of which, I should give them a call.
Because they're real.
Come on, pick up.
Hi honey. Sorry I left without saying anything, got an early call.
WIFE-DIALOG-TEXT-STRING-1
Hah, that is so you. You're too good to me.
WIFE-DIALOG-TEXT-STRING-2
Ain't that the truth. Hey, tell you what, put Little Billy on.
WIFE-DIALOG-TEXT-STRING-3
LITTLE-BILLY-DIALOG-TEXT-STRING-1
Haha, glad to talk to you too, kiddo.
LITTLE-BILLY-DIALOG-TEXT-STRING-2
You caught a shiny what? I can't remember all of the Pokemon, you know that. But I'm happy for you.
LITTLE-BILLY-DIALOG-TEXT-STRING-3
Well, you run along kiddo, daddy's gotta get back to work. I love you. Say bye to mommy for me.
See? Real. And I can't tear that apart, even if it tears me apart to preserve it. This city took a lot of things from me, it wasn't taking my family. Not even if I deserved it.
Find anything?

Groundskeeper said he heard something like an animal running through the yard last night, but when he investigated, there was nothing. Some torn up dirt leading up to the fence, but no footprints. Can't imagine the perp had time to cover his tracks before Stevem got outside with his gun. Must have got out some other way.
We'll have forensics look for more traces, just to be sure.
Of course you would. Any other day I'd be glad to have that thoroughness on my side. But today wasn't any other day.
Maybe the killer got in through the vents.
No, Jesse.
Or used a grappling hook.
NO, JESSE.
Hey, cut the kid some slack. We've seen crazier in our time. Better he's got an imagination than a dead lump of fat between his ears.
Olivia glared at me, but Jesse's eyes gleamed and sparkled with hope and determination.
!!! Nnnh.... Thanks, John. I knew you believed in me!!
No problem, kid.
For all the people who believe in me, who support me, one day, I'm going to be Chief of Police!
Yeah. You mentioned.
Chase those dreams, kid. Check those vents. Sorry, but your first case is gonna go cold, if I have anything to say about it.
Anyhow, mind if I get a look upstairs?
Sure thing, John.
